CatDescriptText: Louis De Simone, 263 Emerson St, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 25, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think children should be given 'allowances' (money)? If so, for what reason or reasons (just to have spending money or for chores done around the house, etc.)?  Do you think that it helps or hinders the development of the youngster?" answer reads: "Yes, because it will teach them how to handle money.  And it should not be solely for work done.  However, it should be partly as a compensation for assuming part of the family responsibilities at home."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Louis De Simone wearing dark jacket and patterned tie with tie bar with saxophone, standing in front of building with leaded glass window
